title: Support single line height terminals
body:
When the following conditions are met, the last line is not shown, what's shown instead is the line above it:
1. The line number is set to be 1 via either the `window/dimensions/lines` option in the config file or the `--dimensions` command line option.
2. The position is set to be a non-default value via either the `window/position` options or the `--position` command line option.
3. More than one lines have been printed to the terminal.

You should be able to reproduce this by doing the following:
```
alacritty --dimensions 20 1 --position 1 0 -e ./a.sh
```
`./a.sh`:
```
#!/bin/sh
printf "123\n456\n789"
sleep 10
```
One would expect `789` to be shown in the terminal window, but what's actually shown is `456`.

OS: Arch Linux
Version: 0.5.0 (and 0.4.3 does not have this issue)
Linux/BSD: X11, bspwm

I think this is probably caused by this:

https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/blob/1bf40a8cc77d9082dfb76e028e0f66af88d79958/alacritty_terminal/src/term/mod.rs#L44

For some reasons, the minimal column/line number of the internal representation of the terminal (`Term`) is set to be 2.

This minimum size is not considered when a `Term` is constructed, but only used when it's resized. Actually except for `Term<_>::resize` I don't think this limit is used anywhere. I think the reason why this problem only occurs when a non-default position is set is probably because of this: I assume setting the position will trigger an "update", and the "update" will cause the `Term` to resize, even to its original size.

I think this can be fixed simply by stop using the minimum size. I can create a PR myself for that. Is there a reason why we want the minimum terminal size to be 2?
